title: Gauge Groups and Lie Algebras
content:

title: Yang-Mills Action and Equations
content:
**Yang-Mills Action**:
$$S[A] = -\frac{1}{4g^2} \int \text{Tr}(F_{\mu\nu} F^{\mu\nu}) d^4x$$

- g = coupling constant
- Tr = trace over Lie algebra
- Integral over all spacetime â„â´

**Yang-Mills Equations** (Euler-Lagrange):
$$D_\mu F^{\mu\nu} = 0$$

where D_Î¼ is the covariant derivative.

**Bianchi Identity**:
$$D_\mu F_{\nu\rho} + D_\nu F_{\rho\mu} + D_\rho F_{\mu\nu} = 0$$

title: Gauge Invariance
content:
**Gauge Transformation g(x)**:

Smooth map from spacetime to gauge group G.

**Transformation law**:
$$A_\mu \to g A_\mu g^{-1} + g \partial_\mu g^{-1}$$

**FUNDAMENTAL SYMMETRY**:
$$S[A^g] = S[A]$$

The Yang-Mills action is invariant under gauge transformations!

This is the defining property of gauge theory.

title: Wightman Axioms and Quantum YM
content:
**Wightman Axioms** for quantum field theory:

1. **Hilbert space**: States form a Hilbert space H
2. **PoincarÃ© invariance**: Lorentz + translations
3. **Spectral condition**: Energy bounded below
4. **Locality**: Spacelike operators commute
5. **Vacuum uniqueness**: Unique ground state

**Quantum Yang-Mills** adds:
- Gauge field operators
- Gauge invariance of physical states
- Asymptotic freedom

**OPEN**: No rigorous construction in 4D exists!

title: The Millennium Problem Statement
content:
**YANG-MILLS MILLENNIUM PROBLEM**:

For any compact simple gauge group G, prove:

1. **Existence**: A quantum Yang-Mills theory exists on â„â´ satisfying Wightman axioms

2. **Mass gap**: This theory has Î” > 0

**Formally**:
$$\exists \text{ QYM}: \text{hasMassGap}(\text{QYM})$$

**Why this is extremely hard**:

- Path integral is ill-defined
- Perturbation theory diverges
- Continuum limit from lattice unproven

title: Known Partial Results
content:
**Asymptotic Freedom** (Nobel Prize 2004):

Coupling g decreases at high energies:
$$\beta(g) = \mu \frac{dg}{d\mu} < 0$$

Yang-Mills becomes weakly coupled at short distances.

**Lattice Yang-Mills** (Wilson 1974):
- Rigorously defined on discrete lattice âœ“
- Shows confinement (area law) âœ“
- Numerical evidence for mass gap âœ“
- Continuum limit? **UNPROVEN**

**Confinement**: Color charges always confined (experimental fact, no proof)
